pr_title: Added verification of node consolidated config property names

timeline.bodyText:
I would suggest doing like : "Enum.VALUE.equals(value)",
good practice
timeline.author: patogalla

replies.bodyText: well.. there're pros and cons.. people from sonarsource suggest using == - https://rules.sonarsource.com/java/RSPEC-4551.
replies.author: Vovchyk

timeline.bodyText: Isnt a way to compare types before going to the switch, it seems redundant to me, asking in each switch statement for the equal type. Whats the logic there?
timeline.author: patogalla

replies.bodyText: I've updated the code a bit.
replies.author: Vovchyk

timeline.bodyText: "(key.isEmpty() ? "" : key + ".")" logic should be outside "for", no need to ask in each iteration.
timeline.author: patogalla

timeline.bodyText: instead of throwing, it would be nice to collect them, and throw/log them all at once.
timeline.author: patogalla

timeline.message: Added verification of node consolidated config property names

timeline.bodyText: Config without systemPropsConfig and systemEnvConfig which are out of our interest
timeline.author: Vovchyk

replies.bodyText: can you add this as a comment on the code directly?
replies.author: nicops

timeline.bodyText: This is the original case? When a misspelled property will be warned... am i right?
timeline.author: patogalla

replies.bodyText: This seems to be my original case presented in #1192. Maybe a comment explaining how we got here can help.
replies.author: lucasvuotto

replies.bodyText: agree, I would add a comment here.
replies.author: nicops

replies.bodyText: Yes, the verify method is recursive one and expectedValue could be null during recursive iterations when an appropriate matching key path is to found.
replies.author: Vovchyk

timeline.message: Added verification of node consolidated config property names

timeline.bodyText: I can see this getting overly verbose and quite difficult to read and search for problems, should multiple configuration problems be present. I suggest making verify return a boolean instead, signaling if the verification was successful, and logging each of the misconfigurations instead of pushing them into problems.
timeline.author: lucasvuotto

replies.author: nicops

replies.bodyText: I just don't want to overarchitect this solution. Good point about doing verification all the time and only throwing an exception if the flag is present.
replies.author: Vovchyk

timeline.bodyText: Can't we run the config verification always and just abort execution only when this flag is set?
timeline.author: lucasvuotto

replies.bodyText: that would be interesting. In which case we catch the exception and only log it?
replies.author: nicops

replies.bodyText: About what exception are we talking? I only see verify throwing an exception if there is a malformed entry in expected.conf.
replies.author: lucasvuotto

replies.bodyText: sorry, I did not read the code carefully between all the changes. Right now this method throws the exception, it could skip throwing the exception if the flag is not set.
replies.author: nicops

timeline.message: Check config settings all the time. Throw an exception if the flag is set

timeline.bodyText: with the latest change, this test and the one above it is not making any assertion
timeline.author: nicops
